Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery krater or dinos; interior glazed black; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of two figures; of the one to left only part of chiton, in added red, and arm remain; on the right bearded head with red scalp hair preserved of second figure, at lower level, to left
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1201)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: UCL n 19 (Other Accession Number)
